2. Political reform dialogue towards strengthening multiparty political dispensation within NCF not yet fully developed. Core Electoral reform proposals already developed/identified. NCF support for approval through next steps of legislative processes needed.

Uganda The overall goal of the Pulse-Lab Uganda Programme is to increase Resilience and well-being of Ugandan vulnerable populations to economic and other shocks with appropriate Government interventions and responses.This will be by (a) Increasing Gov'ts ability to anticipate potential shocks (b) Increase the ability Ugandan NGOs and Private Sector to analyse &focus resources based on real time data (c) Increase ability of a global network real time data partners within UN and host countries of Pulse Labs to use real time data for development analysis and response.

comment.narrative:
1. No data innovation projects in place to advocate for a global partnership to tap into the data revolution to advance/monitor Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
2. No data innovation projects to advance/monitor SDGs with data science.

1. Advance the development of two innovative prototypes to tap into digital data for SDGs localization 2. Execute three pilot projects which demonstrate the use of big data and real-time analyses for the advancement and/or monitoring of the SDGs 3. Organize three advocacy events to build an enabling environment for digital and big data innovation.

1. Two innovative prototypes to tap into digital data for SDGs localization have been advanced and tested: a) Radio mining application and b) Automatic identification and counting application from satellite imagery 2. Three pilot projects which demonstrate the use of big data and real-time analyses for the advancement and/or monitoring of the SDGs have been executed: a) Facebook analysis to document the electoral debate in Uganda, b) Application developed for real-time monitoring of the implementation of the Option B+ treatment, and c) Exploration of utility data (water and sewage) to inform urban planning 3. Four advocacy events to build an enabling environment for digital and big data innovation have been hosted by the Lab

description.narrative: Poaching levels will have decreased

comment.narrative: No mechanism is presently in place for joint management planning for natural resource use by local governments in the critical landscape

District governments in six districts cooperate effectively to regulate and plan natural resource use over 227389 Ha of the critical landscape resulting in a landscape level coordination mechanism that enshrines biodiversity conservation by mandate

Interdistrict coordination mechanism on enforcement and awareness in place and operational involving district political and technical staff It is coordinated by the Resident District Commissioner of Otuke district for the 4 shea butter tree oilt districts of Kitgum Agago Otuke and Abim

i). 1.National charcoal survey finalized validated, approved and database established The national Charcoal survey was finalized and launched for use in updating the database for parameters in the value chain related to production, marketing and transportation. 2. Framework for institutional coordination and resource mobilization in place. The action plans were developed, approved by District councils and integrated in the DDPs. Draft ordinances have been developed and the process to procure a facilitator for the development of charcoal trading guidelines. The process of reviewing charcoal certification schemes is on-going by UNBS. 3. Awareness and educational program on local ordinances and standards for sustainable charcoal was completed.The communication strategy has been finalized and adopted by the MEMD, and is informing the awareness program now and in the future. 4. 4 districts manage and establish dedicated renewable biomass feed stocks and supply improved kilns with renewable biomass 300of 700 planned sample plots have been established in 2 districts of the project area. The activity is still on-going in the other 2 districts 5.Conservation agriculture practices piloted across 240hectares. Up to 16groups of farmers, each with 20members (505 women), have been introduced to CA , covering at least 15 hectare per group. The farmers have realized doubled yields of maize and beans; with conservation compared to conventional agriculture practices.

Evidence that the process of operationalizing a functional Leadership forum(Parliament, Elders forum) has started Output 2 1. 4 democracy institutions with functional e-governance systems 2. 60 districts in Northern and Eastern Uganda with a complete chain of frontline Output 3 1. There is progress of establishing an inclusive and functional Civil Societys engagement platform in place. 2. 35 Members of Parliament and 10 CSOs equipped with knowledge and advocacy skills on accountability for gender laws and policies Output 4 1. 769 number of LCI, II and III court officials trained 2. 26% of cases are disposed through alternative dispute resolutions 3. 3 country diagnostic studies are conducted to inform policy options on national response to sustainability and scalable models.

1. Five (5) analytical/diagnostic studies were conducted and they informed policy options on national response to sustainability and scalable models. 2. Parliament held a radio talk show and a panel discussion on the theme: Democratic Governance and SDGs in Uganda: Challenges and Prospects. This sensitized Members of parliament about Parliaments role in the implementation of the 2030 Global Agenda. Consequently, a motion to debate the role of Parliament in implementation of the SDGs was moved in Parliamentary session of the day. In addition, Newspaper supplements were also run in the New vision and Daily Monitor. 3. Trained 23 Journalists (12 Female and 10 Male) under Training of Trainers (TOT) in evidence based, development reporting and conflict sensitive journalism focused on human rights and rule of law. i. Parliament held an intensive Post Elections Induction Seminar for Members of the 10th Parliament. The Induction equipped the newly-elected members with necessary knowledge and information on; ii. The doctrine of separation of powers, checks & balances iii. The role of Parliament in national governance iv. The legislative process v. Parliamentary practices &procedures, privileges, immunities and etiquette. vi. The National Development Plan, vii. Budgeting process and the Sustainable Development Goals.
4. Trained Programme team 28 people (10 Female & 18 Male) in the areas of Human Rights Based Approach, Equal Opportunities and Gender Equality for programme development, planning and implementation. 5. The Electoral Commissions (EC) capacity was enhanced. Technical experts in voter and civic education, conflict resolution, and public relations and media were employed by UNDP and deployed to the EC. This boosted public trust in the EC and subsequently accounted for a larger voter turnout during the 2016 national election. To-date the EC partially meet the minimum core function performance bench marks. 6. One (01) democracy institution has a functional e-

Specifically; Satisfactory trainees evaluation of the implementation of the proposed inter-ministerial cooperation protocols. 4 inter-ministerial cooperation protocols on the implementation of Rio Conventions are in place, tested and adopted by the State agencies.
2.1 institutional and technical capacities to create knowledge and monitor the implementation of Rio Conventions in place. Annual dialogues involving men and women held by quarters 4,7,10, 13.
